<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 10"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Grave Sight](/Feats.aspx?ID=3607) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Knights of Lastwall](/Sources.aspx?ID=123) pg. 79

**Archetype** [Lastwall Sentry](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=15)

**Prerequisites**
[Lastwall Sentry Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=882); [Grave Sense](/Feats.aspx?ID=885)

</column>

---

Your ability to sense undead has improved. You sense undead as an [imprecise](/Rules.aspx?ID=412) sense with a range of 60 feet: an uncomfortable sensation brushes against your spirit and stinks of rot. When in proximity to an undead, you can sense its presence, but it has the [hidden](/Conditions.aspx?ID=22) condition instead of the [observed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=27) condition. An undead using a disguise or otherwise trying to hide its presence must attempt a [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) or [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) check against your Perception DC to hide its presence from you. If the creature succeeds, it's [undetected](/Conditions.aspx?ID=39), and you have to use the [Seek](/Actions.aspx?ID=84) basic action to detect the creature. As with hearing and other imprecise senses, you still need to Seek to locate an undetected creature.
name: Grave Sight
